articles.title: Trading Day: Resisting renewed tariff tensions
articles.description: Global markets remained resilient despite U.S. President Donald Trump's announcement of a 30% tariff on most EU and Mexican imports starting August 1. European and Mexican markets showed minor declines, but broader investor sentiment held strong, with world equity indices rising, the Nasdaq and bitcoin reaching new highs, and silver hitting a 14-year peak. Encouraging Chinese trade data also supported market optimism.

According to park officials, the North Rim will remain closed for the rest of the season.

articles.title: World news of the day: 14 July, 2025
articles.description: The European Union has refrained from retaliatory tariffs against the United States despite President Donald Trump imposing a 30 percent tariff on imports from the European Union. The US tariffs on the EU will come into effect on 1 August, but the EU is still holding on to the hopes of a trade deal with the US.
